svSweave 1.0.0

svSweave - Sweave, Knitr and R Markdown Companion Functions

Philippe Grosjean (phgrosjean@sciviews.org)

2020-04-14

Source: vignettes/svSweave.Rmd
svSweave.Rmd

The ‘svSweave’ provides different function to better manage Sweaver and Knitr with LyX, a document processor that creates LaTeX code. These function are not detailed here. See their help page ?clean_lyx().

The package also provides function to automatically enumerate and reference figures, tables and equations in R Markdown documents without needing the ‘bookdown’ package. Indeed, this feature is missing in the basic R Markdown documents. The various ‘bookdown’ templates provide a \@ref(label), see cross-reference. The various functions fig(), tab() and eq() provide a different mechanism to obtain the same result: enumerated items and the possibility to cross-reference them in the text. Here an example of a numbered figure with its caption. In order to use these function, you must load the ‘svSweave’ package in a (setup) chunk before you use these functions:

library(svSweave)
#> Loading required package: knitr

Now, you can use fig() to number the caption of a figure in fig.cap= (look at the .Rmd file to see how this is implemented):

hist(rnorm(50))

Figure 1: An example of a simple histogram.

Now, you can reference this plot in the text (see Fig. 1). It works also if the first reference appears before the figure itself, see Fig. 2.

boxplot(rnorm(50))

Figure 2: A second plot as an example.

The same principle works for table, for instance, see Table 1.

knitr::kable(head(iris), caption = tab("a-table", "The few first lines of the `iris` dataset."))
Table 1: The few first lines of the iris dataset.
Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species
5.1 3.5 1.4 0.2 setosa
4.9 3.0 1.4 0.2 setosa
4.7 3.2 1.3 0.2 setosa
4.6 3.1 1.5 0.2 setosa
5.0 3.6 1.4 0.2 setosa
5.4 3.9 1.7 0.4 setosa

Finally, numbered equations are constructed and reference in a similar way, but you must specify "" as second argument where you want to generate the equation number.

  1. \(x=\frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}\)

… and I can reference eq 1 like this.

Enumeration work for now, but it would be fine to have a link to the figure too! To be implemented later on…

Note that the enumeration are calculated as first arrived-first served. This is the correct order in R MArkdown, but with R Notebooks where you may calculate chunks in a different order, you will end up with a strange succession of the numbers, unless you reset everything!

Developed by Philippe Grosjean.
